pageContext.claim: “We got rid of the individual mandate where you were forced to pay a lot of money for the privilege of not having to buy bad healthcare.”
pageContext.analysis: Trump signed a bill that reduced the tax penalty for not buying insurance to zero -- the mandate actually still exists -- but it was never "a lot of money." The penalty was relatively small and many health-care experts thought it should have been higher. For people who bought insurance on the Obamacare exchanges and qualified for subsidies, the monthly premiums are generally under $100.
